summary: This bill, the CEO Accountability and Responsibility Act, aims to adjust the income tax rate of publicly traded corporations based on the ratio of CEO/highest-paid employee compensation to median employee compensation. It introduces a graduated tax increase depending on the compensation ratio. Additionally, it grants a preference to entities with a compensation ratio under 50-to-1 when evaluating bids for government contracts. The bill amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and Title 41 of the United States Code.
